title: Application Programming Interface (API) Gatweay / Extensible Markup Language (XML) Gateway
description: An API gateway takes all API calls from clients, then routes them to the appropriate microservice with request routing, composition, and protocol translation.
key-ideas: Provides an addressable endpoint location for remote applications to access microservices or functions.
The API/XML gateway receives the requests on behalf of the user, routes it to the service, and returns the response from the back-end service to the user on behalf of the server.
Can check authorization for access to service using API keys and JWTs and reject unauthorized service requests.
API gateways are associated with RESTful services and communicate user data using querystring variables or JSON objects in the document body.
XML gateways communicate user data using a structured document format (defined in XML).
Placed logically in front of a load balancer that will dynamically provision and deprovision back-end service functions as demand changes.
